intro: Tiquilia oregana, commonly known as the Oregon wallflower, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves that are often covered in a sticky substance, which helps protect it from herbivores. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Tiquilia oregana is an important plant in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
